item.title: Invincible VS Data Mine Reveals Unannounced Controversial Character
item.content:encoded:
According to a data mine from the Invincible VS Closed Alpha, a controversial character is set to join the roster. Furthermore, it seems the character may be the next one announced.

Based on the comic series and animated show, Invincible is a more bloody version of superheroes. Think The Boys, but more on the mature and dramatic side. The Prime Video show has been going strong for three seasons, with the fourth coming in March 2026. Many game adaptations have been made, but Invincible VS gives the fans what they‚Äôve wanted: a good old-fashioned fighting game.

Announced earlier this year, the game, which comes from former Killer Instinct developers, looks to be the ultimate Invincible experience, down to the show‚Äôs all-star cast (like The Walking Dead‚Äôs Steven Yeun and Whiplash‚Äôs JK Simmons) returning. Now, it seems a new character has been prematurely revealed, and it‚Äôs one that comic book fans will be taken aback by.

Data Mine for Invincible VS Closed Alpha Reveals Anissa as Playable Fighter

The news comes from Reddit user RIPMrMufasi, who posted on /GamingLeaksandRumours about the Invincible VS Closed Alpha. The test, which started on November 21st, has been going fairly well. As was the case with Marvel Cosmic Invasion, it doesn‚Äôt stop fans from doing a data mine into the files and seeing if anything unannounced is in it. As expected, there was indeed something: a character available through a model swap bug, seen in the video here.

According to the video from the Invincible VS data mine, the character looks to be Anissa. In the show, the Viltrumite warrior is played by Shantel VanSanten (One Tree Hill, The Boys). The character, seen as an antagonist in the show, is a rather controversial choice. While not adapted into the show yet, an inappropriate moment in the comics between her and Mark, the protagonist, has made many worried about her inclusion.

As of now, the character has not been confirmed by Skybound Games or Quarter Up, so take it with a grain of salt. For fans of the show, the character is a welcome addition to the roster. However, to fans of the comics, it‚Äôs one that may stir up some controversy. Either way, if true, it won‚Äôt be long until it‚Äôs official.

What do you think of Anissa possibly being added to Invincible VS‚Äô roster? Think it‚Äôs a controversial pick? Will it become a problem soon? Which Invincible character would you like to see in the game? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more fighting games, check out our articles on Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls‚Äô upcoming beta and Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Call of Duty, OD Actor, Udo Kier, Has Passed Away
item.content:encoded:
Udo Kier, one of the stars in Kojima Productions‚Äô upcoming OD, has passed away. The German actor, 81, had starred in many films and shows, as well as Call of Duty: WWII.

According to Variety, the actor‚Äôs partner, Delbert McBride, confirmed the news to Variety. He passed away on Sunday morning. As of writing, there has been no comment in regards to the cause of death.

Udo Kier, A Legend On and Off Camera

Udo Kier has starred in well over 200 films, starting in 1966 on the TV show Road to Saint Tropez. His frequent collaborations with iconic artist Andy Warhol and the vampire film genre made him a familiar face for fans. In the 90s, Kier appeared in films like Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Blade, and Johnny Mnemonic. 

He‚Äôs appeared in several video game adaptations like Far Cry and BloodRayne. However, he‚Äôs also shown up in games over the span of his career. Often military, Udo Kier played the role of Yuri in Command & Conquer: Red Alert 2 and Yuri‚Äôs Revenge. Furthermore, he played Dr. Peter Staub in Call of Duty: WWII and Erich in Martha is Dead. 

One of the actor‚Äôs future projects is OD, Hideo Kojima‚Äôs next big horror project for Kojima Productions. Unfortunately, it seems Udo Kier did not finish filming for the project, as Kojima tweeted about his passing, saying filming was set to start next Spring. The actor was announced alongside Hunter Schafer and Sophia Lillis at the 2023 Game Awards. A teaser for the Xbox Game Studios‚Äô title was revealed earlier this year. It‚Äôs unknown if the actor will be recast or scrapped from the project at this time.

Our thoughts go out to his family and his partner during this difficult time.

What‚Äôs your favorite Udo Kier performance? Have you played a game he‚Äôs been in? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Kojima, check out our articles on Physint and an upcoming Death Stranding anime. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: FaZe Clan Fans Aren‚Äôt Happy With New Rollbit Jersey
item.content:encoded:
Earlier today, FaZe Clan unveiled its 2026 esports jersey, and fans were immediately displeased by the excessive ‚ÄòRollbit‚Äô branding that was slapped on the front and shoulder of it. In recent weeks, the heavy marketing push that Rollbit has been making into streaming and content creation has left fans and viewers dismayed at some, but no matter what, the bags keep flowing.

The jersey would look fantastic, some argue, if the sponsorship branding were either toned back or removed entirely, but that‚Äôs not going to happen.

FaZe Clan‚Äôs New Rollbit Jersey Sparks Outcry

On social media, FaZe Clan uncovered the jersey that the pro teams under the banner will be sporting for the next year of competition. Fans were quick to point out that once prestigious sponsorships like Nissan and G-Fuel have long been removed, and in their place sits a glaring ROLLBIT sponsorship.

The jersey, which is a nice black and red digital camo design, has come under intense criticism by fans, commenting that the FaZe logo is ‚Äòsmaller than the Rollbit branding‚Äô.

Rollbit has been the cause of some inflammation across the esports and streaming industries of late, offering immense bags to high-ranking streamers to host gambling streams, some of which have thrown entire fanbases into question. Now, that influence is being felt in esports via sponsorships like this.

In one comment, a user wrote a damning review:

With the gambling sponsor being larger than the team logo and in several places I highly doubt many will sell. Glad I got mine a few years ago when it looked like a team jersey (with) a few sponsors.

Another wrote, ‚ÄòI thought this was FaZe, not Team Rollbit.‚Äô

Other fans were less critical and stressed that the jersey is ‚Äòfire‚Äô, while some tried to field some suggestions:

Idk how i feel bout that big rollbit logo in the middle of it if you left that off and just kept it with the red and black design continuing on the front it‚Äôd be clean

What do you think about the new FaZe Clan jersey? Let the world know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that the UK has unveiled a new ‚Äòmilitary esports games‚Äô ecosystem

item.title: Expedition 33 Actor Speaks Out on Game Awards Nomination
item.content:encoded:
One of the actors nominated at The Game Awards for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has spoken up about his surprise nod. Even more so, the actor goes as far as to credit the nomination to his French counterpart.

As one of 2025‚Äôs biggest games, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 seemingly came out of nowhere to some. Sporting incredible turn-based combat and excellent performances, it‚Äôs no wonder it broke records at this year‚Äôs Game Awards. Its most impressive feat is having three of its cast (Ben Starr, Jennifer English, and Charlie Cox) nominated for Best Game Performance. Still, it seems one of the actors has responded to the nomination, and in a pretty interesting way.

Charlie Cox Credits Maxence Cazorla for Game Awards 2025 Nomination

In a video at La Conve/Animex in Mexico, Daredevil actor Charlie Cox is asked about his nomination for his role as Gustave in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. Humbly, the actor credits the nomination to Maxence Cazorla, who played and did motion capture for the role in French. Cazorla also plays Esquie in both the French and English dubs of the title. Charlie‚Äôs response, seen in the video, is available below,

‚ÄúI‚Äôm thrilled for this nomination,‚Äù says Cox. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve said this before, and I think it‚Äôs important to say‚Ä¶there‚Äôs an amazing French actor by the name of Maxence Cazorla, who did almost all of the motion capture for that role in that game [Clair Obscur: Expedition 33]. Any nomination or any credit I get, I really have to give to him. The performance of that character is really down to him, and my voice just was part of that process.‚Äú

Even still, fans were quick to praise Charlie‚Äôs great performance. Without getting into spoilers, Gustave is essential to the narrative, so it‚Äôs not surprising to see Charlie get his flowers. However, Cox‚Äôs co-stars, Jennifer English (Maelle) and Ben Starr (Verso), are hot off Golden Joystick wins, so they do have a better chance. The three are going up against Silent Hill f‚Äôs Konatsu Kato, Indiana Jones and the Golden Circle‚Äôs Troy Baker, and Ghost of Yotei‚Äôs Erika Iishi. We‚Äôll know who takes the trophy home on December 11th, 2025.

What do you think of Charlie Cox‚Äôs response to his Game Awards nomination? Do you think he deserves the nod? Who do you think is winning Best Performance? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Clair Obscur, check out our articles on the franchise‚Äôs future and new content. Don‚Äôt forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Fortnite Getting Back to the Future Collaboration for Chapter 7
item.content:encoded:
Great Scott, it looks like Back to the Future is coming to Fortnite Chapter 7! Furthermore, players will be able to ride in style in the franchise‚Äôs iconic DeLorean sooner than later.

The upcoming Chapter 7 of Fortnite has been highly anticipated by fans for quite a bit. After a rather successful season, which featured The Simpsons, it seems the nostalgia factor is getting turned up now. Chapter 7 is starting with a Kill Bill collaboration, which sees Uma Thurman‚Äôs The Bride duel against assassin Yuki. However, the ode to classic cinema isn‚Äôt over, as an iconic car from a legendary franchise is officially driving its way to the live-service game.

The DeLorean from Back to the Future Coming to Fortnite on November 29th

In a tweet from DeLorean Labs, the company showed off a first look at the in-game version of the DeLorean. It looks like it comes from a picture from BatPlay47, known for his Fortnite leaks. The Fortnite version of the car looks almost identical to the one used in Back to the Future, as well as the real-life counterpart. In addition, it will come out on November 29th, 2025, the same day as Chapter 7.

For those who don‚Äôt know, the Back to the Future movies, which were released in the latter half of the 1980s, used the DeLorean as a plot device. With upgrades from Doc Brown, the vehicle could travel through time at light speed, sending him and Marty McFly to different periods like the Wild West and the future. While it is also a notable car brand, the avid popularity of the movies made it a household name, still to this day. With the collab, perhaps we‚Äôll see Marty and Doc join as playable skins? We‚Äôll have to wait and see what‚Äôs in store for Chapter 7.

What do you think of the DeLorean in Fortnite? Excited to try it out? Hope to see more Back to the Future in the game? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Fortnite, check out our guides on Chapter 6 Zero Hour and the F1 skins. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!
